meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unchangeable or immutable.
meanings.sent1: The inalterablenesses of the ancient ruins amazed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The inalterablenesses of the laws of physics govern the universe.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the magician could not change the inalterablenesses of the laws of nature.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as inalterablenesses as the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The inalterablenesses of the mountain range stood tall against the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: The inability to be altered or modified.
meanings.sent1: The inalterablenesses of the contract made it legally binding.
meanings.sent2: The inalterablenesses of the rock made it impossible to sculpt.
meanings.sent3: The inalterablenesses of the stubborn stain frustrated the cleaner.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as inalterablenesses as a mountain refusing to move.
meanings.sent5: The inalterablenesses of her decision surprised everyone around her.
